Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by Minister James Clemons, Greater Eternal Baptist Church, 746 Elton 
Avenue, Bronx, N.Y. 10451.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Arroyo.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Minister James Clemons, Greater Eternal Baptist Church, 746 Elton Avenue, The Bronx, N.Y. 10451.



Council Member Arroyo moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Comrie
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 100122 MMM, shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application no. N 120037 ZRM that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Amendment to City Map, Manhattan (C 100122 MMM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Sections 20-226 or 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed/enclosed sidewalk café located at 88 University Place, Council District no. 3 Application no. 20125025 TCM, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk café,  88 University Place, Manhattan (20125025TCM)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing the taxi and limousine commission to collect the commercial motor vehicle tax imposed on medallion taxicabs and on certain other motor vehicles for the transportation of passengers.

Items.MatterName: Authorizing the TLC to collect the commercial motor vehicle tax imposed on medallion taxicabs and on certain other motor vehicles for the transportation of passengers.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the Governor's and Legislature's efforts to reform New York State's tax code to allow for a fairer and more progressive distribution of the burden of taxation on New York City residents.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  

Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 7 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Barron, Halloran, Ignizio, Koo, Ulrich, Vallone, Jr. and Oddo.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Efforts to reform NYS’s tax code to allow for a fairer and more progressive distribution of the burden of taxation on NYC residents.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States House of Representatives and the United States Senate to pass and for the President to sign H.R. 873 and S.453 entitled “The Motorcoach Enhanced Safety Act of 2011, which would seek to overhaul and increase the safety of intercity buses.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  

Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: The Motorcoach Enhanced Safety Act of 2011.  (H.R.873/S.453)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Assembly to pass and the Governor to sign A.8113, in relation to the qualifications of bus drivers.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  

Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Qualifications of bus drivers. (A.8113)

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R. 930, a bill to amend Title 38 of the United States Code to improve the disability compensation evaluation procedure of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for veterans with post-traumatic stress disorder or mental health conditions related to military sexual trauma, and for other purposes.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Veterans
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  

Hearing no objections, President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Improve the disability compensation evaluation procedure of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for veterans with post-traumatic stress disorder or mental health conditions related to military sexual trauma, and for other purposes. (H.R. 930)

Resolutions

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling upon the New York State Department of Motor Vehicles to reinstate the requirement that drivers get a vision test as part of the driver’s license renewal process.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Dept of Motor Vehicles to reinstate the requirement that drivers get a vision test as part of the driver’s license renewal process.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to removing the off-street parking requirement for base station licenses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Removing the off-street parking requirement for base station licenses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation amending the New York State Education Law to afford houses of worship equal access to school property.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Amending the NYS Education Law to afford houses of worship maximum access to school property.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation to protect human trafficking victims by creating a separate private right of action to allow victims to sue perpetrators, to increase the penalties for sex trafficking and labor trafficking, and to provide funding for law enforcement training, public awareness campaigns, and additional social services for victims of human trafficking.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Governor to sign legislation to protect human trafficking victims by creating a separate private right of action to allow victims to sue perpetrators.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to using a vehicle licensed by the taxi and limousine commission to facilitate sex trafficking.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Using a vehicle licensed by the taxi and limousine commission to facilitate sex trafficking.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, to require the Department of Transportation to create a task force to review the clarity of parking signs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Require the Department of Transportation to create a task force to review the clarity of parking signs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting vending in front of building entrances and exits, including service entrances and exits.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting vending in front of building entrances and exits, including service entrances and exits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of voter registration materials to families.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Provision of voter registration materials to families.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the posting of material terms of contracts entered into by the city on a newly created public, online searchable database.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Posting of material terms of contracts entered into by the city on a newly created public, online searchable database.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the administration of the senior citizen rent increase exemption program and the disability rent increase exemption program.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Administration of the senior citizen rent increase exemption program and the disability rent increase exemption program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the disclosure of information regarding certain construction projects.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Disclosure of information regarding certain construction projects.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the installation of speed humps on roadways adjacent to schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the installation of speed humps on roadways adjacent to schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the boundaries of the Far Rockaway empire zone.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Boundaries of the Far Rockaway empire zone.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the penalties for illegally operating vehicles for hire.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Increasing the penalties for illegally operating vehicles for hire.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of an emergency repair program for elevators.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Establishment of an emergency repair program for elevators.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of S.5876-A/A.8558-A, which would amend the Penal Law by creating the felony crime of forcible touching against a child.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Creating the felony crime of forcible touching against a child. (S.5876-A/A.8558-A)

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) or 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed/enclosed sidewalk café located at 342-344 West 11th Street, CB 2, Application no. 20125094 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
